entries.title: From recovery to regulation: How China's tech giants could fare in 2023 after a bruising year
entries.description: Investors cautious heading into next year in regards to Chinese tech stocks with analysts expecting regulation to be more predictable and growth to accelerate.

entries.title: Disney shares fall following softer-than-expected 'Avatar' opening weekend
entries.description: Analysts pegged the long-awaited "Avatar" sequel as a box office winner for Disney and are viewing the holiday season as a make-or-break period for the film.

entries.title: EV maker Lucid closes $1.5 billion raise from the Saudi public wealth fund and other investors
entries.description: Electric vehicle maker Lucid Group said it has completed a planned $1.5 billion equity offering.

entries.title: Amazon stock gives up last of its pandemic gains after almost 50% slump in 2022
entries.description: Amazon shares have been battered this year by a broader market selloff tied to soaring inflation, a worsening economy, and rising interest rates.

entries.title: Leo Messi used a 'growth mindset' to finally win his World Cup trophy—here's what that looked like
entries.description: It took 35-year-old Leo Messi 16 years, and five tries, to win his first World Cup trophy on Sunday, cementing his status as one of the sport's all-time greats.

entries.title: Inside the largest mansion for sale in Malibu, going for $58.8 million
entries.description: The six-bedroom, 10-bath home is built around an open-air courtyard with lush palms and a koi pond.

entries.title: Jan. 6 committee sends DOJ historic criminal referral of Trump over Capitol riot
entries.description: The Jan. 6 committee's crminal referral of Donald Trump comes as he seeks the 2024 GOP nomination for president, and as he faces two DOJ criminal probes.

entries.title: FTX founder Bankman-Fried sent back to Bahamas jail in day of courtroom chaos
entries.description: Sam Bankman-Fried is returning to Bahamian prison after demanding to see a copy of his federal indictment.

entries.title: EU approves measure to limit natural gas prices in effort to combat energy crisis
entries.description: European Union energy ministers agreed to a "dynamic" cap on natural gas prices Monday after two months of intense negotiations.

entries.title: Millionaire investors haven't been this bearish since 2008
entries.description: Rich investors are betting on double-digit declines in stocks next year, according to the CNBC Millionaire Survey.

entries.title: Historic biodiversity agreement reached at UN conference
entries.description: Negotiators reached a historic deal to protect the world's lands and oceans at a United Nations biodiversity conference Monday.

entries.title: Meta could face $11.8 billion fine as EU charges tech giant with breaching antitrust rules
entries.description: The European Union on Monday issued Facebook parent company Meta with a list of objections over of its online classifieds business, Facebook Marketplace.

entries.title: Fortnite maker Epic Games to pay $520 million in fines in FTC settlement
entries.description: Fortnite publisher Epic Games will pay a $520 million fine in connection with violations of child privacy laws which exposed children to "dangerous" content.

entries.title: Global coal use is on course to hit all-time high this year, IEA says
entries.description: Higher gas prices have led to an increased reliance on coal, the IEA said.

entries.title: Adults are buying toys for themselves, and it's the biggest source of growth for the industry
entries.description: "Kidults" are responsible for one-fourth of all toy sales annually, around $9 billion worth, as they buy everything from Star Wars to Lego products.

entries.title: 'Crunch time': EU members in last-minute push to compromise on gas price cap
entries.description: EU energy ministers are engaged in crunch talks over the details of a gas price cap intended to protect consumers from higher prices.

entries.title: Elon Musk, in Twitter poll, asks if he should step down as Twitter CEO
entries.description: On Sunday, Twitter's new owner and CEO Elon Musk posted an informal poll of the social network's users asking if he should step down as head of the company.

entries.title: The FTX disaster has set back crypto by 'years' — here are 3 ways it could reshape the industry
entries.description: The collapse of FTX, once a $32 billion exchange, has shattered investor confidence in crypto. CNBC looks at how it may reshape the industry in the long run.
